intro: Rapuntium trialatum, commonly known as the golden buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers with five petals. The plant has a basal rosette of leaves that are lobed and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. The seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its distribution across high-altitude habitats.
